Topic.Title: after vote passes when does it close?

Message.Msg: 3rd quarter of the company's fiscal year. Upon approval, the buyer has 20 business days to get financing. If sailing is smooth, end August closing may be possible. Soft target completion before November 1.

Message.Title: Too little, too late
Message.Msg: They shopped for REAL offers for months. Now at the last minute, Icahn offers some BS offer based on a giant loan, giant dividend, and some nonsense stub. If he really saw so much value in Dell, he would have made a real cash offer of $14.50 and forced Michael to react to a real offer. Icahn is just playing games.

Message.Title: Icahn stub and warrant and blah blah blah typical wall street slick thievery.......
Message.Msg: go with the Dell cash deal

Message.Title: Icahn is a stub
Message.Msg: What a total piece of #$%$ this guy is. Offering some nonsense warrant for Dell shares if they ever get over $20? Without the Michael Dell offer, the stock goes to $11. The company is like Blackberry, they are now in severe decline. And as they decline, they will lose the server business and the services that are so lucrative. HP and IBM will take all their customers. This stock is a mess, plain and simple. Icahn justs wants to be put on the board so he can raid the company, force a giant dividend, and leave the company for dead.

Message.Title: warrants are worthless - due to reduction of value of stub equity. So... No point
Message.Msg: "We would note that a portion of any value attributed to the warrants would be offset by a reduction in the value of the recipients’ stub equity, as well as the fact that receipt of the warrant would likely be a taxable event."

Will to go $7 to $8 range once silver lake backs out or deal voted down. Can't wait. Short and risk a loss of $0.30 or buy the August $13 put for 0.28. Either way.. downside risk of 0.30/share is nothing when the upside from the short position is DOLLARS. Maybe 5 or 6 $ in the short term.
